definition: to drink a toast
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]
short speech given in proposing a toast
short speech given in proposing a toast

sentences.english: The most common toast with beer is 'Prost! '('good health').
sentences.chinese: 最常見的祝酒詞是祝你身體健康。

sentences.english: Prof Wang Zihao, the president of BUCT hosted the welcome reception.
sentences.chinese: 王子鎬校長出席了歡迎晚宴並祝酒。

sentences.english: The president will make a speech and propose a toast first, and then the dinner will start.
sentences.chinese: 校長先要致祝酒辭並向大家敬酒，然後就開始了。

sentences.english: Look up the date of the next full moon and celebrate with a champagne toast.
sentences.chinese: 看日期，在未來充分月球和慶祝與香檳致祝酒辭。

sentences.english: An honoured guest should return the toast later in the meal.
sentences.chinese: 本次宴會上一個尊貴的客人要回敬祝酒詞。

sentences.english: Raise a toast to a good day.
sentences.chinese: 爲一個好日子舉杯祝酒。

sentences.english: He was toasted by a11 his friends.
sentences.chinese: 所有的朋友都向他祝酒。

sentences.english: He gave a toast at the party and with that he sat there with no sound.
sentences.chinese: 他做完祝酒辭，然後一聲不響地坐在那裏。

sentences.english: Pat, you do the honors and propose the toast.
sentences.chinese: 帕特，你來敬酒並致祝酒詞吧。

sentences.english: They roared out a drinking song.
The host offers the first toast.
Edward was tolerant to her. He proposed a toast to her happiness.
sentences.chinese: 愛德華寬容的對她，他爲她的幸福祝酒。

sentences.english: He led the way in drinking the health of the newlyweds.
sentences.chinese: 他帶頭爲新郎新娘的健康祝酒。

sentences.english: So I end with a toast.
The wines didn't last past a few toasts .
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒沒有過去的幾個祝酒詞。

definition: short speech given in proposing a toast
to toast/to propose a toast
to toast sb (with wine etc)/to drink a toast
short speech given in proposing a toast
to pour wine or liquor
to drink a toast/Cheers! (proposing a toast)/Here's to you!/Bottoms up!/lit. dry cup
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
to congratulate
feast/repose
to take one's seat
banquet/dinner party/soiree
to add to the fun/to liven things up
to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
lunch banquet
tipsy and merry (idiom)
to urge sb to drink alcohol
